title: Folders created in iCloud does not show in Thunderbird, but when logged in to iCloud
content:
Hi,

Have used Thunderbird on OSX for many many years, with many different accounts.

(Had about 10+ accounts back in the days - phew!)

Now - my main account is Gmail, but I also have an iCloud-account.

These have been working well, but as of yesterday, I suddenly can't create or even see previously created folders on my iCloud account.

They show up just fine if I log in with a browser (total is 7 sub-folders, Trash excluded).

The really frustating thing is that I do in fact see three of the seven folders in Thunderbird. And this is after deleting the account with message data, and re-installing the account (and yes, using an app-specific password in my Apple ID settings).

All folders shows up just fine in Mail.app - but for reasons (message filtering, etc) I really like to be able to use Thunderbird as my mail client on OSX.

First screenshot: iCloud sub-folder list Second screenshot: Thunderbird sub-folder list

Any help/tips/workarounds are greatly and humbly appreciated!

TIA
creator: nicke.wikman

title: Migrate from Outlook 2010 to Thunderbird latest version.
content:
I need to migrate from Outlook 2010 to Thunderbird latest version. There are multiple email accounts configured in Outlook and tons emails. This is my wife's system so I don't want to make a mistake doing the conversion.

I intend to use a automated tool if a reliable on exists - paid is fine. I need to get all of the accounts and associated outlook folders moved to tbird. Also need contacts migrated. Some of the Outlook accounts use POP3/SMTP, some use IMAP.

What is/are the best migration tools? Recommendations welcome. What traps do I need to avoid? What is the recovery process if it all goes wrong.

I have 50+ years IT experience and have used tbird for 10 years so I'm not clueless.

Thanks in advance.

title: automatic message grouping
content:
Hello, I'm using Thunderbird and I'm having trouble with the automatic message grouping.

Even though I have threading and message grouping turned off, Thunderbird still automatically groups emails with the same (or similar) subject into collapsed blocks.

I want each message to be displayed individually, in strict chronological order by date, without any visual grouping.

I've tried switching to Classic View, disabling threads, and unchecking all grouping options, but the behavior persists.

Is there a way to permanently disable this automatic subject-based grouping?

Thank you for your help.
creator: fialap199

title: Intermittent SPAM sorting failures
content:
Hello,

I run TB 141.0-64 with Windows 11 and am on the Release Update Channel. I've had Spam sorting problems for about a year, through many TB updates, and many Windows updates.... I run SFC, and DISM, regularly.

The Spam difficulties are of two types: Many messages appear in my Inbox, are marked as Spam, but are not moved to my Junk folder, so, I move these to their Junk home manually. Also, many messages appear in my Inbox that are obviously Spam, but are not marked as such, and, of course are not moved to my Junk folder. For each of these, I click on my Junk button, and these messages jump over to their Junk home to meet their new friends. Often, messages of this second category, are identical to messages that have been properly moved to my Junk folder earlier.

(Though possibly unrelated, I'll also mention that my CTRL-K Search function has failed for many months, typically, unable to locate messages that I then can locate manually.)

Finally - The the Spam sorting problems I've described, are intermittent. I can sometimes go for many hours with my Spam tools working as they should. Then, the Spam sorting system fails again, as I have described.

I express my thanks, in advance, for any assistance that you kind folks might be able to offer,

Lothar
creator: lotharkrepke

title: Thunderbird
content:
Recently my Intel NUC died and I have switched to using n ASUS Strix laptop with a Synology NAS storage. Since that switch whenever I start up Thunderbird I receive this error message; " The folder ‘Inbox on meddingsbasil@gmail.com’ could not be compacted because writing to folder failed. Verify that you have enough disk space, and that you have write privileges to the file system, then try again."

I am not sure if the error is in my ASUS Strix or in Thunderbird or elsewhere. If you can help, please note that I am a senile old geezer of 95 years and 7 months. I used to be OK with computers but I am now getting forgetful of how to do things.

Can you help ??

Basil Meddings

title: Sending of the message failed. An error occurred while sending mail. The mail server responded:  [VO-101] Message blocked due to spam content in the message.. Please check the message and try again."
content: I get the following message from Thunderbird and denying to send it: "Sending of the message failed. An error occurred while sending mail. The mail server responded: [VO-101] Message blocked due to spam content in the message.. Please check the message and try again." I spent quite a bit of time with my ISP and the tech did a number of tests and then determined that it is a Thunderbird problem. She then had me go into Thunderbird outbound settings and check "Normal Password" once or twice and the problem was solved for about 2-3 weeks...until today. The system is back at it's old tricks and now I can't even send out a message with a simple link to a story, article, etc. Not always, but if I try to send it to 10-20 friends, it kicks the message back with the above message. Needs a permanent solution. Thanks.
creator: jvm11

title: apertura automatica delle email
content:
Buonasera,

ogni volta che sposto nel cestino una mail da una cartella di "posta inviata" o "posta in arrivo" il programma Thunderbird apre automaticamente la mail immediatamente successiva a quella eliminata.

Questa procedura automatica comporta il fatto che in caso di eliminazioni multiple la pagina risulta intasata da una serie di mail aperte senza alcuna necessità.

Chiedo quindi se è possibile eliminare questo automatismo.

Grazie per l'attenzione

Gianluigi Rossi Loc. Valdana 9 - Porto Azzurro- LI
